text: Yappity-yap~ It's Francis!
Japanese baked goods are not only tasty,
they come in all sorts of cute shapes!
The next stop on our bakery tour is Boulangerie Shima,
known fondly as Shima Pan or Shima Baked Goods.
What cute baked goods do you have here?
Here it is: a melon bun shaped like a turtle~
Look!  An exercising bear!
Why do you make baked goods in the shape of animals?
Let's go to our next bakery when the rain stops.
There it is: Sekimoto!
Feast your eyes on these beautiful fruits!
Can you all guess what I am about to show you?
What are your most popular items?
Cream and fruit, sandwiched between two slices of bread.
Looks great, doesn't it?
Mr. Sekimoto's fruit sandwiches are very popular among fruit aficionados.
Mr. Sekimoto and I are quite alike, it seems...
I had a great time meeting my guests for today.
They all wake up at the crack of dawn to make delicious baked goods for their customers.
I will meet a lot more people and show all of you further facets of Japanese food culture!
I must go now.  Chef is waiting for me!
